messages.message: I hear that upcoming 22.10 is a patch release for 22.08 yet I also hear to expect it to be buggy.  Not sure what to think and what to plan on for a customer delivery

I can try to provide some more details later after my meetings. No need to ask this on too many channels because then I have to chase down them all to make sure no one gets misaligned. :slightly_smiling_face:

22.10 is not a patch release to 22.08; it is also not supposed to be buggier than any other major release. Because of the short gap between 22.08 and 22.10 there are fewer features shipped compared to the previous 2 major releases that have 3 full months of dev time.

+1 to what Kerry said. It is definitely a major release, and will go through the same testing as our other major releases. The only difference is because there was < 2 mo between 22.08 and 22.10 there are fewer new features. You can get a sense of this by referencing the Product Overview doc (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ypvtd1N97hFFKVRerP5SKWR253IiY_zDxOmtO3lMq4U/edit), and comparing how there are relatively few entries in 22.10 compared to 22.08.
@Dale DeLoy can you please share where you heard this from? I want to make sure I can get everyone aligned on expectations for the release.
